title: Ticket #4341: condor_sockaddr::is_link_local fails to detect IPv4 169.254.*.*
description:
johnkn reports that on his Windows box, HTCondor really, really likes advertising his IPv4 link local address (169.254.x.x). He has a publicly routable address, so this is wrong. The public address should be preferred to the link local.

Theory: condor_sockaddr::is_link_local (/src/condor_utils/condor_sockaddr.cpp 586) is wrong. It's using a hard coded test (0xa9fe0000 & address). That code smells fishy to me. In particular, is the endianness correct?

Confirmed: The test is wrong. Original code tried to hard code an integer value and failed to account for endianness.

See also #4345
